intro: Hypecoum glaucescens, commonly known as the blue-flowered hellebore, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant has palmate leaves with a waxy texture and a distinctive, somewhat toxic sap. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Hypecoum glaucescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
